name: The Westin Dawn Beach Resort & Spa, St. Maarten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I Stayed at the Westin St. Maarten for 5 nights during Christmas week 2007. I am a traveler from New York (Manhattan), am a Starwood Preferred Guest Gold Member with many worldwide stays under my belt, and I have high expectations for the hotels I frequent. This Westin property met those expectations.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience in St. Maarten/St. Martin

reviews.text: As you’ve probably noted from other reviews, renting a car is a must for your vacation here, and in particularly for the Westin. In general, the roads on St. Martin/St. Maarten are narrow and difficult to navigate, so the fact that the hotel has poor signage made finding the Westin a bit difficult. Once there, however, the hotel itself is gorgeous, and beats anything else in terms of modern, spacious, and comfortable accommodations.
reviews.title: The Westin Dawn Beach Resort and Spa Sint Maarten N.E.

likes.disliked: — Too Americanized for a tropical vacation.

reviews.text: NO BED BUGS HERE. I was somewhat concerned when I read a negative review about this property, claiming that they had bed bugs in the room. I can’t imagine this to have been true. You should discredit. The rooms are very clean, white duvet cover, Westin Heavenly Bed (I also have one at home, and I think its very comfortable).
reviews.title: Possibly the nicest place to stay on the island !!!

likes.liked: — Most beautiful resort on the island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located on the Dutch side of the island, but definitely commuting distance to the French side's Orient beach and all of the great restaurants on the island. In my opinion, if you want to have the comfort level of a modern luxury hotel, it is worth commuting when the alternative is paying more for less on the French side.
reviews.title: Best hotel in St-Maarten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a basic room on hotels.com for $325 per night (very reasonable for Christmas week) which was far less than the Internet rate from Starwood, and also did not have a minimum stay requirement. I had a courtyard view, beautiful terrace. I’ve heard that some of the basic rooms have a view of the parking lot, which I imagine would not be so great. I think the best value would be if you could save enough Starpoints to use for this vacation.
reviews.title: Stay Away!

reviews.text: Do not expect a 5 star out of this hotel; however, considering its the only 4 star "chain" on the island you will be guaranteed good service.
reviews.title: 100% a 4 Star hotel

likes.disliked: — Trying to Charge $1 per minute for internet use

reviews.text: Cons:
reviews.title: Wonderful resort

likes.liked: — the pool, the rooms were very modern and clean
likes.disliked: — A lot of traffic from the airport to get to the hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1) They charge $6.50 to make an outgoing call and then $4.50 per minute, even if you use an international calling card!!!
reviews.title: just great!e

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2) Their business center charges $1.00 "per minute" to use the internet which I think is horrible since the internet is coming into the hotel
reviews.title: One of the best vacations ever

likes.liked: — Beach and pool were amazing, rooms and bathrooms were huge, view was amazing, staff was incredibly friendly and helpful
likes.disliked: — No where to pick up snacks ora quick bit to eat on the premises

reviews.text: 3) $80+ daily for a cabana by the pool, which is only the typical type you'd find in Walmart/Target with no additional benefits other than providing "shade". There is no shade by the pool nor the beach and you have to pay $20 to rent an umbrella at the beach.
reviews.title: Liked the Westin. Oceanfront rooms are great!

likes.liked: — The ocean front room and beautiful pool.
likes.disliked: — The way it looked when driving over the hill and seeing the roof! Also the weather!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for 6 nights and we wouldnt stay anywhere else on the island again. This place is absolute paradise. The staff is very friendly and accomodating. The pool and beach are magnificent. We have been coming to St. Maarten for yrs and have a timeshare. We stayed at The Westin for 4 nights and went to our timeshare. Well after 2 days at the timeshare we decided to head back to the Westin. The reservation department was great and even provided us the same oceanfront room that we previously stayed in.
reviews.title: Wow, The Westin should be ranked # 1 hotel on the island

reviews.text: Bring your appetite to the Pirate Buffet. Flank steak, chicken, ribs, mussels, shrimp, oysters, and a plethora of delicious desserts to choose some even a guavaberry creme brulee which was out of this world.
reviews.title: Westin does it again

reviews.text: The heavenly beds are just that, heavenly, it was hard getting up in the morning until I opened the shades and saw the crystal clear waters. The rooms are great, they provide nice cozy robes, the bathrooms are spotless and huge. The pressure from the dual action showerhead makes you want to stay in the shower forever. But we didnt. The staff came and brought fresh towels every night along with chocolates. We even came back to the room some night and found fresh fruit and other little treats.
reviews.title: The Wonderful Westin, St. Maarten!
Absolutely wonderful!!!
reviews.text: The pool is freshwater and very clean. The pool features a swim-up bar as well. The lounge chairs are very comfortable. There are bose speakers along the outside of the pool which makes a nice atmosphere. Although one day they played all jazz flute music which forced me to put my headphones on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are two restaurants and one night club in the hotel. We went during the offseason and so one of the rest. and the nightclub were closed. The casino is located in a great location, right near the lobby. The lobby is very comfortable and there is a bar next to the casino and lobby.
reviews.title: Westin - Great Service and Amenities

likes.liked: — Westin service/quality, and no kids during the off-season.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose Westin -St. Maarten because we have a ton of SPG points and wanted to go somewhere warm.
reviews.title: Recommend for St. Maarten

likes.disliked: — Spa expensive, not enough restaurants on-site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Terrible, Avoid,
Very Nice Hotel, Like Sister Hotel in Cayman
reviews.text: Excellent service - everyone was also very friendly and more than helpful. They allowed us to check in at 11:00 am and upgraded our room to ocean front free of charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice resort - not a 5 star but definitely an excellent 4 star that is new!!
reviews.title: do not stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very large infinity pool with numerous nice lounge chairs with a swim-up bar.
reviews.title: Best on Island!

aka: The Westin Dawn Beach Resort & Spa, St. Maarten Hotel
description: Located on one of the most beautiful Caribbean beaches, The Westin Dawn Beach Resort & Spa, St. Maarten offers guests a true getaway. Scuba dive, take a ferry to Anguilla for the day, or just relax.
